mdRecord.dcterms:description: Dome collar showing Blashfield mural: Islam, Middle Ages, Italy

The decoration on the base or collar of the lantern [in the dome above the reading room] consists of a ring of twelve seated figures, male and female, ranged against a wall of mosaic patterning. They represent the twelve countries, or epochs, which in 1897, when the building was constructed, were thought to have contributed the most to modern civilization. • Egypt represents Written Records. • Judea represents Religion. • Greece represents Philosophy. • Rome represents Administration. • Islam represents Physics. • The Middle Ages represent Modern Languages. • Italy represents the Fine Arts. • Germany represents the Art of Printing. • Spain represents Discovery. • England represents Literature. • France represents Emancipation. • America represents Science. -- http://myloc.gov/ExhibitSpaces/MainReadingRoom/TheDome/Pages/default.aspx [work]
